results.title: Germany through the eyes of its youth
results.brief_description: German children express their feelings about the division of Germany in various art forms, painting, drawing, and modelling. Students selected from 80,000 entrants give impressions of ‘indivisible Germany’. These dramatic visualisations range from conventional pencil drawing and painting, to collages, bas-reliefs, and sculpture, all conveying the intensity of feeling Germany’s youth has toward reunifying their country. ‘All Germany at one table’ is an often heard slogan in the west.

results.title: Germany of today
results.creator_credit: G. Buckland-Smith, Greenpark Productions and Clive Rees
results.brief_description: Traces the evolution of Germany from Charlemagne ti the present day. Stresses early disunity and rivalries of Emperor, Princes and Church. Unification in the 19th century; destruction in the Second World War followed by a rapid economic recovery, epitomised in the changing face of Bonn the new Federal Capital. Early history is portrayed in architecture, sculpture and art.

results.title: Germany of romance
results.brief_description: Accompanied by traditional music and the music of Wagner, Schumann, Brahms and Bach, the prospective tourist is shown the great man made and natural attractions of Germany and given glimpses of old and modern German life.

results.title: Germany and its shadow
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television and Arthur Zegart
results.brief_description: An assessment of the New Germany ranging from the country from Hamburg in the north to the Bavarian town of Landsberg, where Hitler wrote “Mein Kampf”. With its re-awakening forces of German Nationalism, is there a danger of Germany again being led down the familiar path to war?

results.title: Gerald Mcboing boing (K)
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow, United Productions of America, Bosustow Entertainment and Robert Cannon
results.brief_description: At first, young Gerald’s boings, honks, beeps, toots and train whistle noises nearly drive his parents crazy - and when time and even school fail to teach him to actually talk like other children, the situation grows bleaker. Rejected by his peers, an outcast in a world of words, the friendless Gerald runs away from home. Then from a dark and dreadful snowstorm he is rescued by the owner of a radio station who needs just such a lad for his sound effects department. At last Gerald has found his niche. From the story by Dr Seuss, adapted by Bill Scott and Phil Eastman and narrated by Marvin Miller. Animation by Bill Melendez, Rudy Larriva, Pat Matthews, Willis Pyle, Frank Smith. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Georgie to the rescue
results.creator_credit: Israel M. Berman, Viking Films Miniature Film Studios and Richard Slapczynski
results.brief_description: An animated film about Mr and Mrs Whittaker who live in the country with their pet cat and their friends Miss Oliver the owl and Georgie the gentle ghost. Based on the book by Robert Bright.

results.title: Georgian background
results.creator_credit: Clement W. Bending, Gateway Film Productions, Educational Foundation and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: Shows through dramatised scenes, museum pieces and contemporary architecture the way of life of English people in the eighteenth century. Dress, household objects, furnishings and re-enacted social occasions; travel by coach; the landscape showing the enclosure movement; the spinning jenny and the beginnings of the Industrial Revolution; examples of eighteenth century art.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clement W. Bending, Gateway Film Productions, Educational Foundation and W. Hugh Baddeley

results.title: Georges Rouault (1871-1958)
results.creator_credit: Texture Films, Isabelle Rouault, Pierre Courthion and Genevieve Nouaille Rouault
results.brief_description: A film on the twentieth century master painter Georges Rouault, his childhood, the atelier of Gustave Moreau, the scandalous Fauves, violent social protest, the Miserere and the last glowing Biblical Landscapes.
